intro: Coccoloba cholutecensis, commonly known as the Cholutec beauty, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in El Salvador and Honduras. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically lobed and have a distinctive, ornamental appearance. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded areas within forests. Due to its unique foliage, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens and greenhouses.
